abstract.p: Photos of scooter riders in New York City

block.p: It's a far cry from the Depression-era 2 by 4 with roller-skate wheels and an orange crate in the front. The new scooter is another obstacle for pedestrians, who have been dodging in-line skates, skateboards and bicycles on the sidewalks. A few scooters are battery-powered (top, far right), but the cheapest and most popular is the six-pound, collapsible (left), metal model. Sneakers are the key fashion note, to grip the board. Could this be the first big fad of the 2000's?
